page.title: 14HOUSING - Lydham/More
page.content: Majority of houses are old, built of stone and modernised within the last 20 yrs. Some are still 'tied' to jobs on Linley Estate. Most houses in the past were connected with agri- culture but less so today. Both villages have{council houses,}22 in Lydham (rent approx Â£17 weekly), built of red brick; 4 in More (Â£15 weekly) built of blocks made at the More quarry. The Old Rectory and Church Farm at More are black and white timb- ered houses. {New houses}in the area are mainly red brick{bungalows}which cost approx Â£22,000 to build with an additional Â£5-7,000 for a building plot. Plots are not easily available. At present there are none in the Lydham/More area unless connected with agriculture. {Mains water}to most houses. No mains{sewage,}only septic tanks and soak away drainage.
